website_summaries.verdict: The Epson Perfection V550 Photo Color Scanner makes high-quality scans from both photos and film, and can scan directly to Facebook and cloud-based sites.
pros: High-quality scans for a flatbed scanner at its price
Can scan slides, negatives, and medium-format film as well as prints
Digital ICE hardware-based dust removal for film
Can upload scans directly to Facebook and cloud-based services

customer_reviews.title: Dreadful interface and poor software with an ill conceived and clumsy design
customer_reviews.text: This is the clumsiest, unreasonably complex and badly thought out scanner I have ever owned ( I have bought and used 10) It is quick to awaken, slow to respond and switches off at the drop of a hat. The software has actually become worse in the 10 weeks I have used it and now crashes between single scans. I could write a page on this cursed thing but my time is not worth the wasting.
customer_reviews.author: doctired

customer_reviews.title: incompatible with Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: Don't buy this, it is not compatible with Windows 10. Instructions on CD are for Windows 7 and XP (remember that?). Software crashed repeatedly on Windows 10. Shame, as it is a good-looking piece of equipment and the scans it produced between crashes seemed sharp. Perhaps Epson could update the software? Windows 10 is not exactly new.
customer_reviews.author: IAN M.

customer_reviews.title: Epson V600 faulty after 18 months of light use.
customer_reviews.text: Despite the one star this is a good scanner. The problem I have is it's durability or should I say the lack of it, considering it has had only light use I would not have expected any problems after using it for only 18 months. However I find when using the top scanner for scanning negatives or transparencies I get a dark line going through the entire strip making them unprintable. After spending £200 on the V600 and it being only six months out of guarantee I can't say I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: St. Alcon

customer_reviews.title: What I like about Epson products is that they provide excellent Linux ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a replacement for an old Canon scanner. What I like about Epson products is that they provide excellent Linux support (unlike Canon who seem not to of heard of Linux!). The drivers and software work perfectly on my Linux mint 17 system. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: ianP

customer_reviews.title: To work with macOSX Mojave you need to buy more software
customer_reviews.text: Sadly Epson are not maintaining the Epson Scan utility which has been a good application to drive Epson Scanners. Sadly it no longer works with macOS Mojave V 10.14.4. Given that all Mac applications will have to be 64bit compatible for future versions of macOS the existing Epson apps will die in the next version of macOS. Fortunately there is a third party scanner software that does work - Vuescan by Hamrick Software, it also supports most scanners regardless of age so if you are buying a V600 to replace an obsoleted scanner, try using Vuescan with your old scanner before buying a new scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Derek R Wright

customer_reviews.title: An excellent scanner. I have used it for some months ...
customer_reviews.text: An excellent scanner. I have used it for some months now with no problems. Some people criticize the on/off button, and I agree it is a bit fiddly but I soon got used to it. Lid stiff to lift, but then it stays in the lifted position while you arrange the items for scanning. I found that by making my own cardboard mask I could scan quarter plate negatives. I have since bought the Canon MG7550 printer, and its installation stopped the scanner functioning, and I had to download a fresh driver from Epson's website, and on installation the scanner was operational again.
customer_reviews.author: Topcat

customer_reviews.title: but now it's working great & I've copied a lot of my old photos
customer_reviews.text: I had a few problems getting it to work properly at first,due to software issues, but now it's working great & I've copied a lot of my old photos... I find it better to copy the photos than the negs as the negs are often a little old & need too much cleaning...... The only problem I have with copying the photos is that I put them in order of when they were taken, but the machine goes all random on me, which is a bit annoying as I have to adjust the time as well as the date on my laptop, but I still like it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Read me!
customer_reviews.text: The power switch is hidden on the right hand side, towards the back! Took half an hour to discover it! A sheet of instructions stuck on the top would be a good idea, Epson! I eventually found the install cd-drivers installed... Review: After the initial difficulties, scanner installed correctly on XP sp3 and Win 10 Absolutely excellent scans-very detailed, dust free The transparency holders are very flimsy, but useable: there is nothing to stop the slides falling through! The film strip holders tricky to use-but flimsy: excellent scans The "error" and power on leds close together: can be confused... Verdict: excellent results, but minor design faults... Recommended!!! Very pleased overall-workflow a bit contorted...
customer_reviews.author: S. R. Sanford

customer_reviews.title: Failed to function due to archaic software supplied
customer_reviews.text: I though it was just me, but after a generous friend who specialises in Mac IT had wrestled with it for two hours, it became abundantly clear that the 2014 software supplied with the Epson Perfection 600 is sufficiently bug-riddled to fail in all of its advanced functions; I was able to kick-start it beyond a basic flat-bed scanner only after spending an additional £75 on independent scanner software. Epson evidently are no longer moving enough of these scanner to motivate them to upgrade their software. Avoid, at least until they begin to take us remaining customers at all seriously.
customer_reviews.author: TheProf999

customer_reviews.title: A Good Scanner
customer_reviews.text: I have been using it to scan my granny's old negatives and slides which come in a wide variety of archaic shapes and sizes, and it does a good job. It's a bit slower than one would like. The software is rather unstable and is prone to crashing or becoming unresponsive. Make sure you click the right buttons and best not to run any other applications while scanning. However the colour correction function does work very well on old colour negatives and slides from the 1960's and 1970's. It can also be used to improve black and white images. When it does work, the results are very good.
customer_reviews.author: Slush

customer_reviews.title: Excellent scanner
customer_reviews.text: We had one of these on loan from a neighbour, but found it was so good that I had to buy my own to convert our boxes full of old slides and negatives to digital photos - which then could be edited. I am very happy to have bought this scanner, as it can scan negatives and slides to a resolution of up to 6400dpi. But this takes time, often several minutes - the result is really worth waiting for.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Tilly

customer_reviews.title: Neg frames a bit flimsy but over all good value.
customer_reviews.text: Only one thing lets this down a little and that is the frames for holding negs, they could have small bars across to help straighten curved film, which does happen sometimes in processing and storage . Scans are very good though not as good as my film scanner which has sadly died, but then it was a lot cheaper than my Med Format scanner cost. All in all a jolly good piece of equipment that if you didn't know better you would be very pleased with. Don't be fooled by ICE, keep everything clean and don't use it for better sharper results! I recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Alan potts

customer_reviews.title: Existent product but dodgy software
customer_reviews.text: I use the scanner mainly for photographs negatives and slides. I got this to replace an Epson perfection 4870 scanner that wouldn't. work with a recent IMac computer. The P600 is a very good scanner but the software disc that came with it was incomparable and out of date. That issue was eventually resolved by contacting Epson support and being able to download the correct software via a link. Things are running fine now but it would have been a lot better if workable software had been supplied at the outset
customer_reviews.author: John D. Carey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent film/photo/document scanner
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so that I could scan in a load of really old negatives. It does a very good job; it's easy to use, scans quickly, gives very good results. I've also scanned in a number of photos, which came through very well. Much better than using an all-in-one scanner (which I'd tried, but it gave very poor results on negatives). It seems to be quite robust, as are the (several) negative holders that come with it. Not cheap, but as they say, you get what you pay for. Very pleased with it - I did use Epson's Support, which was very helpful and sorted me out very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Mojo

customer_reviews.title: Two faulty machines that wouldn't work
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like this machine as it didn't work from the outset. I was immediately sent a replacement scanner - after trouble shooting with the helpful Amazon online support service - and had the same problem with the replacement. The machine wouldn't switch on and the light indicator didn't work. I decided to go for a different brand of scanner - as this was very disappointing and frustrating when I had been relying on using it for work purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Chico

customer_reviews.title: Almost obsolete.
customer_reviews.text: BE AWARE. Epson appear to have pulled the software for operating on Mac OSX Catalina. I bought mine about a year ago and it is now useless. Mac do support an app to run the machine but it is very poor and the ICE technology and other features do not work.
customer_reviews.author: rickshaw

customer_reviews.title: No software support
customer_reviews.text: Do not touch with a barge pole if you are a Mac user. They do not supply software but get you to download it from Silverfast and wash their hands of it when the software continually produces error messages. Epson support could not care less. Total miss-selling. Go elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: CAVOK

customer_reviews.title: Quality and quantity.
customer_reviews.text: The product is as big as a pillow. Makes noises like a spaceship setting off and huge. Don't let that put you off, it's incredible. Huge file size if you have the time to scan and go out for the day or paint the kitchen. I honestly think it is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. L. J. Thompson-murphy

customer_reviews.title: at best, be described as rubbish
customer_reviews.text: Well it's not got much going for it. No on / off switch. It's noisy. The software can, at best, be described as rubbish. I should really have sent it back, but I was in urgent need of a scanner to replace my previous Epson scanner (which was great, but Epson have not updated the driver for Windows 10). I will replace it with a better model (not sure if it will be Epson) and bin the V39 as it is not fit to hand on.
customer_reviews.author: BGW

customer_reviews.title: Does almost everything you can ask.
customer_reviews.text: Great scanner. Really good software once you experiment with it.Bit slow but the quality is very good. The plastic film holders are a bit on the flimsy side but I managed to do 4000 35 mm and 2000 print scans in three weeks with this machine and had no issues.On off switch is on the side,which sometimes is a pain.Should have been on the top.
customer_reviews.author: Alistair

customer_reviews.title: Buy it
customer_reviews.text: Genius machine. Fast, fast, fast. Using it to scan thousands of my wife's old photos. Can scan both sides at once, but back not automatically enhanced, which is a shame because it works a treat on the front. Software could use some improvement. File naming system a bit crude. Scan options a bit limited, but pretty idiot proof. Instructions basic, but once you have realised the photos go in upside down etc, it just works. Didn't need tech support, hence no rating. Ideal for the job
customer_reviews.author: the_fiddler

customer_reviews.title: It feels very plasticy and light but scan quality is very good I tried some of the customisations
customer_reviews.text: it scans well but i cannot download any of the software either from disk or website... It feels very plasticy and light but scan quality is very good I tried some of the customisations, pics attached, hope this is helpful...
customer_reviews.author: sd

customer_reviews.title: useless
customer_reviews.text: Will NOT connect to wifi, I have spent a whole day trying, had an IT tech friend he tried to. Useless product as 1, can only use my USB lead, 2, details on sales page are not correct. Had to send it back, total waste of money, time and effort. Never go near Epson again
customer_reviews.author: Vimto man

customer_reviews.title: No Depth of Field Whatsoever...
customer_reviews.text: I had an excellent Epson V100 which I used for years until it finally gave out. I thought that the V39 would be a replacement. Big mistake. The V39 is only good for scanning flat pieces of paper or photos. Nothing that requires any depth of field whatsoever will come out. That means any images behind glass or anything resting other than dead flat on the scanner bed (including copying from books). So, I am having to get another - the Epson V370 reportedly does not have this problem.
customer_reviews.author: Prof. K. C. MacDonald

customer_reviews.title: Good value film scanner
customer_reviews.text: I occasionally need to scan 35mm and 120 film negatives, but mostly I use this scanner for scanning documents. The scanner has a fast warm-up time and scanning time for various media are comparable with the V800, which I have used in the past for a project. The biggest difference I notice between this and the V800 is that the V800 film holders take twice as many negatives. So far when scanning films negs I have not noticed any difference in the quality of scans on 120 film negatives. Therefore I consider the V550 to be a value for money scanner.
customer_reviews.author: J. Small

customer_reviews.title: Short lifespan- not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Having had my scanner less than two years, and having used it infrequently, I'm really annoyed to discover that it's stopped working! For the price, I expected this product to have a bit more life in it. It turns on, but doesn't start up and get ready to scan anymore. I'd say we've used the scanner a couple of times a month, if that, so this really isn't good enough.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner for 35mm negatives and slides
customer_reviews.text: I have used this to scan about 150 rolls of 35 mm negatives and about 200 slides also some prints. It quite fast and much better than the cheap Cannon scanner I had before. The Epson software is quite good but does not reduce dust on negatives however the SilverFast software does a better job (you get a free licence to this with the scanner) however it's not as easy to use, but once you have learnt how to use it scanning is quite fun.
customer_reviews.author: MDP

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a year and a half ago to replace an old Epson Perfection scanner. It's very light, and (micro) USB powered, which are good things. However, that's about it. The V39 really struggles to reproduce colours accurately. This is particularly pronounced on anything glossy, but even on matt documents it seems to get confused by colour gradients, which turn out quite 'blocky'. It is also about as slow as any other flatbed scanner I've used in the last 15 years - you'd think they would have made them faster by now.
customer_reviews.author: T Y

customer_reviews.title: Serious work in progress.
customer_reviews.text: Arrival took me by surprise, two days earlier than the first date I'd been advised and there I was thinking "Oh yes, it will arrive on the last date quoted" excellent service from the distributor and delivery company. Colour Balance and Tech Support I'm unable to comment on, haven't used yet although only photo I've printed looks OK. I'm not the brightest Tech person so some of the instruction jargon will by-pass me and I might have to ask for support, we'll see. I have over 300 B/W negatives from 1955 Hong Kong as well as several hundred more slides and pictures from many overseas holidays, my Lock-Down couldn't be at a better time.
customer_reviews.author: Trenton

customer_reviews.title: Good scanner for photos
customer_reviews.text: This was bought to replace an older Epson and is as good with a few improvements. It is hugely better at scanning negatives and slides, and the lid can stay open half opened which is a real plus. The only downside I can see is that the on-off switch is not easy to locate unless you can easily see it. But a minor gripe.
customer_reviews.author: Mogodon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent image quality scanner
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scanner based on recommendations from fellow photographers who have used a similar Epson scanner to scan their 35mm and medium format negatives ad slides. The scanner is really easy to use and the quality of the results is outstanding compared to what I have used before. This is a must have for any film photography enthusiasts or people who need to digitise their old negatives, slides and prints. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant scanner and even better service from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: On the 13th Jan went to Curry's as this was advertised on their web site for £170.99 -not in stock. Went round the corner to Argos who wanted £199.99 -not in stock. Went on line at 1.20pm same day and ordered it through Amazon £169.50 including delivery and it arrived just after 10am this morning 14th Jan. I have been using it since 11.30 am and it is scanning my photos a treat. I can place various size photos on the bed and as long as a leave a gap between each it gives me separate Jpeg images of each photo. Brilliant scanner and even better service from Amazon. I won' waste my fuel in future.
customer_reviews.author: nigel

customer_reviews.title: This is SLOW to make a scan and it does not produce a same-size copy of an original.
customer_reviews.text: This is supposed to be a photos and document scanner, but it's obviously intended for photos because it's just taken me 18 mins to scan a black and white document! I'm sending it back. It's slow, it chucks out 2 pieces of A4 from my printer (rather than just 1 page), and it's trimming the edges so it's not a true scan/copy of a document. I ONLY WANT A DOCUMENT SCANNER! It claims to scan documents but is not doing its job at all well. Rubbish.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable results, but dated technology.
customer_reviews.text: This scanner worked well enough for what I needed - transferring images from various formats of positive film. While there doesn't seem to have been much progress in the consumer A4 scanner market over the past few years (scanning speed, USB3 interfaces etc) the V550 carried out the tasks I asked of it effectively - albeit after quite a bit of faffing around setting it up. If you need to scan film this unit should do what you need. If you're just looking for a flat-bed image scanner I'd suggest you look at the Canon range which are much more compact, have better drivers and software and are quieter in use.
customer_reviews.author: Booleanboy

customer_reviews.title: Seriously Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I did not know what to expect for the price of this scanner, but I have to say that I am seriously impressed by its first use. I scanned my artwork and was blown away by the quality of the scanned image; I need to spend time now to see how the various adjustments affect the finished scan & also to try out the stitching function for an A3 original. So far though this scanner has outperformed my old Canon 5600F.
customer_reviews.author: CollieCottage

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Mac compatible Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a proper scanner not one of those 3-in-1 jobbies where you have a printer, copier and scanner. So glad I did as well, the scan quality is incredible, easy to use and the file sizes are small enough to be stored online for storage, i.e. dropbox. Very happy with the purchase. Did quite a lot of research on getting the best one for my needs This is configured for my Mac so software works fine with no issues. Am running 10.12.6 on my Mac just incase you wanted to know.
customer_reviews.author: MR W CHAUDHRY

customer_reviews.title: Well done Epson
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely delighted with this amazing machine. I have loads of old negatives and photographs and i have wanted to get them copied and onto the computer for ages and ages. This particular machine was recommended to me as an alternative to the Epson V700( which seems very hard to find new) and it does a fabulous job. I don't know much about the Digital Ice feature except that it works. Another bonus is the fact that it is quite simple to use, not being a genius with computers and things i have soon got the hang of it even using professional mode and i am currently scanning for Britain!....Marvelous don't hesitate!
customer_reviews.author: John T.

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done with some effort
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily for slides. It produces excellent output with 2 provisos. The first is that the slide holder would be better if it held the slides rather than just act as a template. This would help if the slides were damaged. The second is that the automatic feature of the software frequently crops the slides by a significant amount , you need to delve into the settings to make sure you capture the entire slide. This can slow the entire process down.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Beware!
customer_reviews.text: I was super secured to get this item, however upon doing a few test scans I noticed that it was scratching my photos. The scratches were very light, but definitely there - when you look inside you find there are plastic guides instead of rubber wheels like you’d find on a Doxie. Shame really as I wanted to up my scan quality (which is great on this machine given how quickly it is scanning).
customer_reviews.author: Dg

customer_reviews.title: Epsom V39 scanner
customer_reviews.text: Load the software that comes with it and it is simplicity itself to use, click the icon and it scans automatically and saves it in the Scanned documents folder. It is light and easy to swap from one PC to another. It produces good results and unlike the scanners that are combined with the printer, it will never ask to replace the ink cartridge before scanning.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Mills

customer_reviews.title: Scanners: read the reviews carefully
customer_reviews.text: Arrived but did not work: had to send it back. Also, be aware that Epson have a poor record in continuing to provide support software. I had to buy Vuescan software for my Epson perfection 1200u. It's now becoming difficult to find really good scanners as the market for scanners is contracting.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Rolf

customer_reviews.title: Very, very nice machine
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with performance and in particular the film scanning into my iMac. Would have given it five stars but the software only seems to address 35mm and 6X6 cm films, and I have to scan some other (eg 127) size negatives. I am doing this using an older sibling, a 22-year old 1240 Perfection scanner which works with Win10 but not the iMac (it still performs faultlessly after all these years and I appreciate Epson build quality).
customer_reviews.author: K. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Very good scanner only slight problem
customer_reviews.text: The quality of this scanner is really good, sometimes it doesn't get the image spot on the first time but this has only happened a handful of times. The lid also can be a little awkward as sometimes it does not want to close but overall I'm really happy with the quality of the photos that I've managed to scan. You can also scan two photos at a time, which is very useful as I'm trying to scan thousands of old family photos.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew and Amanda Cockman

customer_reviews.title: Really simple to start using...except ion you have a Mac
customer_reviews.text: Liked that it was easy to get going BUT, if problems soon started in terms of compatibility with Apple...if you are happy running on old IOS then it works. It does NIOT seem to work well with Mojave and all lawyer versions. Epsom and Apple unable to resolve issues. Sometimes it works and sometimes it does not. Using the scanner on an old MacBook Pro that has not been updated, the scanner if fine.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Good working scanner
customer_reviews.text: I have scanned over 200 negatives since I bought the scanner and it is very good. I changed some of the settings to get a higher quality scan on auto from my negatives and that has worked very well. Scanned a few Photographs and they look good too. I am very happy so far with the scanner
customer_reviews.author: alan

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't power on
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a year ago but unfortunately couldn't use it until recently. When I unpacked the scanner and tried to use it, it would not power on. I was 7 days beyond the warranty and was told it would cost £125.40 to fix the issue. The scanner never worked in the first place and cost me nearly £200 to buy. I am very upset and gutted about this and believe I was sold a broken scanner that I am now going to have to bin.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Love it! I was impressed in how light it ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I was impressed in how light it is, almost like a lap-top. After years using my Epson V200 I had to update it and what a change! It connects via USB, so there are less cables around, you can remove the lid if you need to scan books or over sized documents. I use it to scan watercolors and it does a great job, however, the paper has to touch the screen and can be tricky if your paper is too wavy. It is not particularly noiseless, but I can live with it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Almost disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to copy some of my old slides to digital. Had initial problems with software as would not load on to my iMac - almost returned item, but after researching the web, downloaded software from Epson site. Scanner is now working and have scanned a few of my slides (almost 40 years old) and am very pleased with results. Looking forward to finding out full potential of scanner, pity though about initial hiccup.
customer_reviews.author: David C

customer_reviews.title: Great for archiving all those old snaps
customer_reviews.text: Brought this scanner as I’m on a mission to archive all my old photos, and I have to say so far I’m very impressed. It was easy to setup on my Mac, didn’t bother with the supplied CD just downloaded the software, connected to the Wi-Fi with no problems and was up and running in 10 mins! Quality in both 300 and 600 dpi settings is good. Love the fact that is integrated with Photos on the Mac, so all photos go straight into the Library. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be aware with current Mac software
customer_reviews.text: The scanner may be good at what it does, but cannot confirm as the accompanying software does not function on my Mac. This unit also had no setup instructions with it, forcing me to go online to an outside source. After arranging a return I got advice from a friend who downloaded the latest software from Epson support and set machine up via YouTube tutorial. Will now keep device. Shame Epson could not make things clearer for their customers. Seems like a good product though.
customer_reviews.author: colin j allen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Scanner, poor software (if non standard negatives).
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good scanner. The only reason it dropped a star is due to the software supplied. I have some strange sized old negs and it took quite a bit of fiddling to get the scanner to scan them at their correct size. There are ways and means but theses options are hidden away in the menus and not really obvious. In fact I resorted to making my own template for some of the negatives and then oversizing the scan. This worked fine.. That said it is a very good quality product, but software should be looked at again
customer_reviews.author: Ian W

customer_reviews.title: excellent for film
customer_reviews.text: after a bad experience with the v500 (which I returned) I gave a try to the v600 because I simply couldnt find another alternative to scan film at this price level. The scanner works well, and seems quite fast to me, even if that is not really an issue because I dont have a large collection to digitalise. I currently use it on a mac with epson software, which looks a bit old but works. The film holders included in the box are a bit cheaply made, but do their job with both 35 and 120. Slides not yet tested. Overall recommended
customer_reviews.author: G.P.

customer_reviews.title: Very good for scanning slides
customer_reviews.text: This scanner has been in the market for many years but it is very good for scanning slides. Software shows its age but it does its work and there are a lot of settings you may modify to improve the scanning process. Results are really good for me that I have to scan a lot of slides taken during many years and travels.
customer_reviews.author: Paolo

customer_reviews.title: This scanner is brilliant. I previously had the Plustek OpticFilm8200iAi which I ...
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is brilliant. I previously had the Plustek OpticFilm8200iAi which I returned as faulty as it gave inconsistent results, and the Silverscan software was difficult to use. The Epson V600 is a breeze to use by comparison. The supplied software works really well. Automatic colour and exposure correction is very effective, as is the ICE dust removal (except on Kodachromes where artifacts are left along high contrast edges). Any further touching up can be done in the supplied Photoshop software. Have completed scanning over 300 of my Dad's 50yr old slides, and the results are amazing - they have truly been brought back to life. Thoroughly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: njroyle

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant!
customer_reviews.text: I needed this scanner for a specific job - scanning negatives of different sizes not seen since 1945. It has been brilliant.....quick, efficient and easy to use......very good purchase. Scanning to a computer has been almost a joy.....certainly worth the outlay to get a scanner of this quality.
customer_reviews.author: Colin Mustoe

customer_reviews.title: Great workhorse,
customer_reviews.text: Good quality scanner I only use epson scanners as in professional mode you can really adjust the scan and the software is simple to use . I use it professionally every day and the last one lasted for 14 years.. I had dropped it a couple of times and it was held together with gaffer tape .. still worked well. The best in any price range
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Works  well with 10
customer_reviews.text: Used have a Canon Lide 25 on W7 but no driver on this good old scanner for W10. Hence bought this one. Installation slow but obviously looks to see what system is. Works well, I do not use buttons on front. Scanning software is good once you get used to it. Fast enough for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: brabason

customer_reviews.title: Great product great service
customer_reviews.text: I have had some very old negatives that I could not get on most standard scanners this one did the job so happy to see photos of people long gone but the scanner is fantastic and this company have been a pleasure to deal with updates all through until arrival on my doorstep thank you
customer_reviews.author: Paulc

customer_reviews.title: It does the job but not professionally
customer_reviews.text: A do like this scanner but I did think the professional setting would be of a higher quality. I produce paintings on commission and scan them in so I have a digital copy for myself and I was hoping for a better quality, as I had read online better purchase that it was. It’s effective but not what I expected
customer_reviews.author: tyler c.

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner if you need high resolution and want to scan maybe four pictures at once.
customer_reviews.text: For me though with less needs, a regular all in one does the job for home stock and a bit quicker. On the negative side - sorry negative as in film - negative scanning is a plus but it will not scan the old instamatic 110 sixe film - which it turns out I have a lot of. I found the proprietary extra high res speck-removal setting didnt actually improve pictures by much and took an awful long time to scan. Nevertheless, it does the job, although perhaps expensively.
customer_reviews.author: gerrard

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased at how easy to use this  scanner is
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased indeed with this scanner. Very easy to set up and simple to use. I use it to scan original artwork with a view to producing prints. The Scan-and-Stitch facility is a doddle to use - thankfully (I'm not teckie!). Scan colours on screen are good - not so good when printed but that is an issue with my printer.
customer_reviews.author: PaintyM

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product overall.
customer_reviews.text: A quality scanner for a fair price. Scanning a color film on TIFF format with 48bit color and 6400 DPI will produce a file of around 280Mb and around 46MP Scanning a B&W film on 16bit grayscale on TIFF format and 6400 DPI will produce a file of around 98Mb and around 46MP Happy with the quality of images overall. Four stars because of the plastic film holders that feel like they could break with the slightest mis-handle.
customer_reviews.author: iLLUNiS

customer_reviews.title: Odd marks on images and has stopped working after only 7 months
customer_reviews.text: Originally I was very pleased with the quality until I noticed there were dark marks on the pictures it scanned, at first I thought it was the picture themselves, but I soon realized the exact same mark was on all the images scanned. *Edited* I've had the scanner roughly 6-7months and already it has stopped working. I have tried serval different leads to connect the scanner to and even set it up all over again, which was a big waste of time as it still won't work. It won't connect to the computer I just keep getting error messages.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Salt

customer_reviews.title: Very poor.
customer_reviews.text: First I will mention the positive(s) of this product, when you scan a picture this comes out decent, now for the negative(s) the construction of this product is very poor, feels cheap and very flimsy, the lid is very wobbly and it takes an age to scan anything. Not at all impressed with this Epson product.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. I. P. Grieve

customer_reviews.title: Excellent results and glad to have it on my desk
customer_reviews.text: An excellent production and, with plenty of 30mm slides to scan, is giving good results. I would have liked the ability to do more than 4 at a time but it's the scans that matter! You can also scan film strips and some other formats. It's worth reading the spec carefully if you use less common formats.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: It’s OK
customer_reviews.text: Technically good scanner spoilt by crashing driver, tried installing the update from Epson but it does not work on my PC.
customer_reviews.author: phydaux

customer_reviews.title: Epson V600 Flat Bed
customer_reviews.text: I have Epson 4490 and Minolta Film scanner that died on me .so as Epson had good reviews so I bought V600 .so I have 2 Epson now I think V600 is bit better than my other one was going for a film one don't think they as good as the Minolta was flat beds are lot quicker any easier to use with good neg or slide some seem to be better.
customer_reviews.author: alan

customer_reviews.title: Good intermediate quality scanner
customer_reviews.text: My previous scanner would not work with Windows 7 and there was no available software update. I chose this model as one suitable for achieving good, albeit not professional, reflective scans. I have a dedicated film scanner so I was not really interested in using the V6000 for film scans, though I have tried it and found it very satisfactory. I have certainly been pleased with the reflective scans.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Jones

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and does a good job.
customer_reviews.text: It's great. The only issue I have is that I often need to push the scan button twice as I get a warning message about not being able to communicate. I don't know if this is the scanner's fault or not. Other than that it does the job very, very well. Great for documents and photos and can scan straight to PDF.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Braeman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent scans of 35mm negatives
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to scan in 35mm negatives on a Mac. I scanned and printed some black and white negs and compared them with paper prints I created in a darkroom and there's nothing to choose between them (at 10" x 8" size). The negative holder allows you to scan 12, 35mm negatives at once so although the scanning process can take its time, you can just leave it to get on with its job.
customer_reviews.author: David Travis

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Brilliant.
customer_reviews.text: There are plenty of great reviews online about this product, so mine will be short and to the point. This scanner is bloody brilliant. Why would anyone pay for the £700 to £750 option one, when this does everything you could possibly need in a flatbed scanner. I purchased this for mostly doing photo restoration work, and it works a treat, especially the digital ice facility. I've not tried the film or negative slots you get with this yet, but I'm sure they are just as great, with great results. Some very good reviews already online about them. So yes, buy this scanner people, you will definitely not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Soprano

customer_reviews.title: Excellent machine for digitising photos quickly
customer_reviews.text: If you have thousands of photos sitting in boxes and would like to digitise them, this machine is excellent. It scans 36 photos in about 30 seconds, labelling them with dates or descriptions as required. The quality is good. I haven’t tried printing from the digital files yet, but they look fantastic blown up on a 55” TV screen.
customer_reviews.author: DITJ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for art work
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so I could scan my art work. Can scan up to A3, can control the colour and dpi. Easy to set up and use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overal good scanner but could be a better.
customer_reviews.text: Good scanner , I like that you can fully remove the lid, but I don't like that the lid removable mechanism is made of plastic that looks flimsy and easily breakable.With Windows 10 and 8.1 the Epson drivers work well. Happy that is very light and I can easily put aside when not used.
customer_reviews.author: Hackney girl

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Been scanning some old slides from the early nineties, the quality is outstanding. I made the right choice with the Epson v600.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Quite surprised how good this scanner is for the price
customer_reviews.text: Quite surprised how good this scanner is for the price. Bought it mainly to scan photos for a family archive. Lots of old black and white photos from the 1920's scanned perfectly. Little enhancement required in Photoshop as originals were good. Colour repro was Ok. Some adjustment required to optomise some photos but for the price a very good piece of kit...
customer_reviews.author: Adrian M

customer_reviews.title: Best flatbed scanner for prints.
customer_reviews.text: I am working with paper negs and needed a flatbed scanner to copy up to 4800dpi, this did the job perfectly. Its simple to use with a mac and the scanner draws its power from the USB port. Be aware it is not suitable for film,if your working with 5x4 you need an imacon or an Epson V750
customer_reviews.author: Crocker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, rapid delivery.
customer_reviews.text: However, the delivery driver left this item in full view outside my back door, rather than in the shed opposite the back door, which is my declared "safe place". It was irresponsible to leave such an expensive item in full view.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Scanner but get the Windows 10 interface sorted!
customer_reviews.text: The scanner sis a great scanner. I could not get it to work with windows 10. This caused me huge frustration. There was no useful information on the web although it was clear that this is a well known problem. Eventually I got the scanner to work by using a USB 3.1 cable to the usb 3 port on the computer. The scanner is not usb 3 capable but the work around was successful although I still get a message at the beginning of each scan saying the scanner is not working.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Epson V600 Scanner
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my old Canon film scanner that somehow got lost when I retired. I needed to scan two thousand negatives, mainly 6x7cm and 6x9cm. This machine coped very well and results were fine for my requirements. Much better than the old Canon 9900F film scanner. The downside was no 5x4inch option and I had to mess about scanning these negatives to get most of the image. Prior to buying the V600 I borrowed the V700 to try out. It's not worth the extra money. Regarding scanning prints, I still use my Canon LiDE 210. It's much better, quicker and easier. So if you are only going to scan prints, don't bother.
customer_reviews.author: exprophoto

customer_reviews.title: Epson V600
customer_reviews.text: I had been pondering a film scanner for quite a while to archive those old prints, negatives and slides accumulated over the years. The V600 with ICE Technology for both film AND prints sold me. The results are truly superb - The software included (Epson Scan) works well on my iMac, but the buttons on the front don't function for some reason on a Mac (OK on a PC though I believe). The ICE Technology works like magic - Removing dust spots and scratches. The penalty is time. A scan with ICE enabled probably doubles the scan time - Something worth considering if you have a large number of negs/slides to scan. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Geezer

customer_reviews.title: if you have something that needs a good scanning and don't want to deal with a host ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my grandfather too scan his slides, works amazingly well he loves it. Without being ageist he's 84 and can work it perfectly well, if you have something that needs a good scanning and don't want to deal with a host of technical setups and questions I recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Rhys

customer_reviews.title: Works well, quite fast at 3200dpi.
customer_reviews.text: Great device. Easy to set up and I managed to scan all of my slides (around 500 or so) without too much problem. Takes about 6 minutes to do 4 slides at 3200 dpi. Would have been nicer to have been able to scan in batches of 12 instead of 4 - there's plenty of space on the glass - but it's a good unit.
customer_reviews.author: Space Boffin

customer_reviews.title: Fine when actually working
customer_reviews.text: I had this for just over a year. Only light occasional use, for uni work etc. There is a certain connectivity issue - was always fairly temperamental; dropping power and also taking ages to turn on once plugged in. At first I thought it might be a dodgy cable, or perhaps Mac compatibility, but after trying various cables (which work with other appliances) and also trying to connect on my friends PC, it isn't even connecting/turning on anymore. Shame, as it was good in general and not exactly cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Keri T.

customer_reviews.title: Canon LiDE 220 was a better scanner, tested them side by side
customer_reviews.text: thought the Canon LiDE 220 was a much better scanner myself, it was a bit faster and easier to operate. still the epson did a great job of scanning but my money got the Canon and glad I did. They were tested side by side. Both good scanners but Canon has the edge in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: Really pleased
customer_reviews.text: Really pleased, easy to set up and use it am 70 female not very with it when it comes to electronics etc., but this was a breeze
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really great scanner for 35mm and for documents
customer_reviews.text: Great scanner best I have ever used and I used to do tech support for scanners, this scanner is amazingly accurate can't fault it, if you have lots of old 35mml or medium format film from prehistoric times ;) this scanner is the ticket it also turns document scans into pdf's and lot's of other nice tricks, for the price it's well worth the little bit extra
customer_reviews.author: Jimathome

customer_reviews.title: Good but does some annoying things when copying slides
customer_reviews.text: It does a good job as I'm copying slides, but it has an annoying habit of turning slides when previewing and when I abort to reset, I have to turn it off and sometimes my laptop too to get it to be recognised.
customer_reviews.author: John Whittall

customer_reviews.title: Epson V39 Scanner
customer_reviews.text: The v39 performs fairly well, although it is not as good as Epson 1660 it replaced (not compatible with windows 10.) The v39 is a little flimsy, but so far performs well enough with good colour balance.
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: This is VERY impressive
customer_reviews.text: As soon as it arrived, I opened the box, install the software and followed the instructions to start using it. It helped having watched a couple of videos on YouTube. Super easy to use and extremely happy with its performance. It is really impresive! Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: reiphoto

customer_reviews.title: I bought one new from Amazon years ago
customer_reviews.text: It is till going perfectly, well about 10 years on. I use it almost daily as a pro photographer, from 35mm to 6x6 with my Rolleiflex. Buy it and you will never look back
customer_reviews.author: STAR

customer_reviews.title: Epson Perfection V39 seems to be very good.
customer_reviews.text: Copied a document and did what it was supposed to do. I was impressed with the quality of the print. It worked first time out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Barrow

customer_reviews.title: Works on Ubuntu Linux
customer_reviews.text: Chose this model primarily because it states Linux explicitly. Runs without a problem on Ubuntu
customer_reviews.author: FutureWaves

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Works very well and quality scans. Installed to operate with my MacBookPRO no problem at all.
customer_reviews.author: RobertM

customer_reviews.title: but I am somewhat disappointed. It does scan well
customer_reviews.text: I expected a superb scanner, but I am somewhat disappointed. It does scan well, but not much better than my Epson printer/scanner. It is marginally quicker, but no revelation.
customer_reviews.author: Silverybells

customer_reviews.title: A bit loud
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality, the negative feature is a bit hard to use, but if you have a bit patience, it all works well. It's not the fastest and it's loud when scanning.
customer_reviews.author: S Chen

customer_reviews.title: High quality at a low price
customer_reviews.text: As a flatbed scanner user of some 22 years, I have been through many different makes and models, including high-end Hell and Dainippon 48-bit scanners. The V600 delivers amazingly good scans, even from 35mm transparencies and negatives. The interface is simple to use, effective, and contains sufficient controls to produce a raw scan ready for any further processing in, say, Photoshop. The media trays work effectively, and even a novice will find their purpose and where the fit on the bed easy. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Roger M. Kean

customer_reviews.title: Epson Scan 2 software is rubbish
customer_reviews.text: Scanner itself is fine, the 1 star is because the software with iOS Catalina is rubbish. Epson Scan 2 has so many bugs and seriously needs an update soon.
customer_reviews.author: Geo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent so far
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Scanner arrived not quite 4 hours ago and now have it set up and working, despite discovering my iMac's CD/DVD player is kaput! Delighted with scans so far, and the seller bmi solutions deserves five gold stars too for putting up with me and providing outstanding service. Will review seller properly when amazon gives me the opportunity. And will review the scanner again once I've used it a bit more.
customer_reviews.author: Elma McMenemy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent scanner. The ICE technology is impressive at removing ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent scanner. The ICE technology is impressive at removing imperfections on old slides. At 2mins per slide scan and with 1600 slides ahead of me, I'm sure to be well aquainted with this scanner over the coming months!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Griggs

product_meta.title: Epson Perfection V550 Photo Scanner
product_meta.description:
Style Name:V550

The Perfection V550 Photo is the versatile photo scanner that gives your old photographs a new lease of life.

You can easily scan a range of negative and positive film – up to medium format - and use Digital Image Correction and Enhancement (ICE) Technology and Epson Easy Photo Fix software to transform your old photos into crisp, clear digital images, all in a matter of moments.

Fast, high-quality scanning:

Thanks to Epson Matrix charge-coupled drive (CCD) technology and an optical resolution of 6,400dpi, every detail is faithfully captured.

With fast, energy-efficient Epson ReadyScan LED technology, there's virtually no warm-up time, so you can start scanning your photos and films almost instantly.

Restore old photos:

With Digital ICE Technology, damaged film can be digitally repaired without the need for time-consuming retouching. Imperfections, scratches and fingerprints are all removed from scanned film automatically.

In addition, Epson Easy Photo Fix restores faded colour, removes the appearance of dust, and adjusts backlight to bring your old photos back to life.

Negatives to digital:

The built-in transparency unit allows you to scan two 35mm filmstrips (12 frames) or four 35mm mounted slides at a time and also supports medium format film.

You can also scan up to A2-sized pages, such as large photos, newspaper articles, posters etc. with ArcSoft Scan 'n' Stitch Deluxe software.

Scan to cloud:

Epson Easy Photo Scan enables direct scanning to selected social media and photo sharing websites, as well as other cloud storage services.

You can access your photos from almost anywhere and share with friends and family.

Energy saving:

With virtually no warm-up time and low energy consumption, this photo scanner can help reduce your energy bills and impact on the environment.



BOX CONTAINS
Epson Perfection V550 Photo Scanner 
35mm and Medium Format Film Holders 
Scanner Installation CD-ROM 
Scanner Set-up Poster
Hi-Speed USB 2.0 Cable 
AC Power Adapter and Cord
feature_bullets: DIGITAL ICE (Image Correction and Enhancement) technology: Restore old, damaged film
Scan to Cloud: Upload photos directly online
Transparency unit: Film, slides and medium format film
Quick start up: ReadyScan LED technology

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,214 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
